greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum array of Catalan numbers A000108 read by upwards antidiagonals.
comment: The underlying array A is A(n, k) = Sum_{j=0..n } binomial(n, j)*A000108(k+j), n >= 0, k>= 0. See the example section. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Oct 04 2019
link: P. Barry, A. Hennessy, The Euler-Seidel Matrix, Hankel Matrices and Moment Sequences, J. Int. Seq. 13 (2010) # 10.8.2, page 5.
formula: T(n, k) = A(n-k, k) = Sum_{j=0..n-k} binomial(n-k, j)*A000108(k+j), n >= 0, k = 0..n. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Oct 03 2019
maple: # Uses floating point, precision might have to be adjusted.
mathematica: T[n_, n_] := CatalanNumber[n]; T[n_, k_] /; 0 <= k < n := T[n-1, k] + T[n, k+1]; T[_, _] = 0; Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 9}, {k, 0, n}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 11 2019 *)
program: if n == k : return binomial(2*n, n)/(n+1)
for n in (0..5): [A106534(n,k) for k in (0..n)] # _Peter Luschny_, Aug 16 2012
xref: Cf. A059346 (Catalan difference array as triangle).
results.author: _Philippe Deléham_, May 30 2005
